dt: {bc}the unity of Father, Son, and Holy Spirit as three persons in one Godhead according to Christian dogma
{bc}a group of three closely related persons or things
{bc}the Sunday after Whitsunday observed as a feast in honor of the Trinity

et: Middle English {it}trinite{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}trinité{/it}, from Late Latin {it}trinitat-, trinitas{/it} state of being threefold, from Latin {it}trinus{/it} threefold
shortdef: the unity of Father, Son, and Holy Spirit as three persons in one Godhead according to Christian dogma
a group of three closely related persons or things
the Sunday after Whitsunday observed as a feast in honor of the Trinity

dt: river in eastern Texas flowing southeast into Galveston Bay

shortdef: river in eastern Texas flowing southeast into Galveston Bay

dt.t: According to legend, St. Patrick used the shamrock to explain the {wi}Holy Trinity{/wi} to the Celts.

dt: {bc}a group of three things or people regarded as having fundamental importance or prominence in a particular place or area of interest or activity

dt.t: By September, the region's famous foliage is emerging, the air is crisp, and it's prime time for the first two sports of the Woodstock {wi}Holy Trinity{/wi} of fishing, biking, and skiing.
I grew up in a town so white that our celebrity {wi}holy trinity{/wi} consisted of Martha Stewart, Paul Newman, and Jason Robards.
Vanilla, chocolate and strawberry, the {wi}holy trinity{/wi} of young ice-cream purists …
… mocks the {wi}holy trinity{/wi} of the art world—sex, drugs and pretension.

dt: {bc}the combination of onion, bell pepper, and celery as it is employed in Cajun and Creole cuisine

dt.t: Almost every traditional Cajun recipe calls for the merged flavors of the {wi}Holy Trinity{/wi} to serve as its underpinning, rendering the three aromatic vegetables the most prized ingredients of all in New Orleans cookery.

shortdef: a group of three things or people regarded as having fundamental importance or prominence in a particular place or area of interest or activity
the combination of onion, bell pepper, and celery as it is employed in Cajun and Creole cuisine

dt: {bc}the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit existing as one God

shortdef: the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit existing as one God
